snippet: The New York Police Department can claim many victories, but it is consumed by a single imperative: crime and homicide rates must keep falling.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column asserts the New York City Police Department is consumed by drive to push down crime and homicide rates and that manipulation of crime statistics may be widespread; describes several incidents in which officers have come forward with evidence of questionable practices, only to be reprimanded by the department.
lead_paragraph: The New York Police Department can claim many victories, but it is consumed by a single imperative: crime and homicide rates must keep falling.

headline.seo: No Room for Dissent in a Police Department Consumed by the Numbers
headline.main: No Room for Dissent in a Police Department Consumed by the Numbers
headline.print_headline: No Room for Dissent in a Police Department Consumed by the Numbers
